qas.question: When was Nanjing considered to be the biggest city in the world?
What was the number of people in Nanjing in 1400?
When did Nanjing cease to be the capital?
Where was the capital moved to?
Who was the third emperor of the Ming dynasty?

context: It is believed that Nanjing was the largest city in the world <a0_0>from 1358 to 1425<a0_0/> with a population of <a1_0>487,000<a1_0/> in 1400. Nanjing remained the capital of the Ming Empire until <a2_0>1421<a2_0/>, when the third emperor of the Ming dynasty, <a4_0>the Yongle Emperor<a4_0/>, relocated the capital to <a3_0>Beijing<a3_0/>.
